page.title: 13RAINBOW WARRIOR
page.content: One Hall Russell built vessel currently in the news is the 'Rainbow Warrior',the flagship of the environmental pressure group 'Greenpeace'.Built in Aberdeen in 1955 and christened 'Sir William Hardy' she was Britain's first electric diesel trawler. M.A.F.F.used her for research work into advanced catch handling techniques at their Torry Research Station.Sold to Greenpeace in 1978 she has been at the forefront of their campaigns against whaling by Icelandic and Russian fleets and nuclear dumping from Sellafield on the Cumbria coast. Tragically she was blown up and sunk in Auckland Harbour this month killing one crew member. Sabotage was the motive probably because she was on an anti-nuclear mission in the Pacific to have culminated at Muruoa Atoll where the French are testing a H-bomb.
